title: Devi Kundan Haaram: Divine Elegance for Your Auspicious Moments
materials: Hyderabadi Polish. The gold used is of exceptional purity
lasting luster. The Kundan stones are meticulously set
features: This exquisite Haaram showcases intricate Kundan work, a hallmark of traditional South Indian jewelry. The centerpiece is a Temple Jewelry inspired pendant, featuring a meticulously crafted Devi idol. The chain itself is made of woven gold beads. The pendant is flanked by peacocks, symbols of beauty and prosperity, in a Nakshi design. The Ruby cabochon adds a touch of royalty.
colors: Dominant gold with pops of Ruby red and Emerald green. The Kundan stones provide a shimmering white contrast
occasions: and other significant celebrations. Its timeless design also makes it suitable for grand receptions and cultural events.
description: This Haaram is more than just jewelry; it is an heirloom. The traditional Kundan setting and temple design evoke a sense of cultural heritage and divine blessing. Each gemstone is carefully selected for its quality and brilliance. The Hyderabadi polish ensures a lasting shine and durability, making it a treasured piece for generations. The peacock Nakshi work showcases exceptional craftsmanship.
